ratings.comment: Was a 5th-grade teacher and it shows, doesn't speak up, and doesn't provide clear instructions. Often rambles. Not professional. Uses derogatory language because its 'in the legislation', also stereotypes. skipped entire disability groups because 'lack of time'. However, the workload isn't too much and exams are open resource unlimited attempts.
The single worst class and professor of my life. Didn't learn a thing, all questions, homework, exams, and quizzes were horribly constructed, and every lecture felt like the same material. STAY AWAY.

I really liked this class and Professor White. It wasn't difficult and she seemed like she cared about the material. The only thing is that I don't feel like the CBL was integrated well into the class. You're only required to do one discussion post a week and there's only a few quizzes that are pretty easy. I never read the textbook and was fine.

She is super nice and the class was actually so easy. She cancel class a lot. Best part of class is when people come to speak. Lectures are super short. She means well but seems to not really know what she's doing. Basically always graded on completion I ended with a 100%. If you're an education major def take this class its a breeze.

Dr. White is very kind and very intelligent, but there really isn't anything to glean from her lectures. She won't record class if you're ill or offer virtual options, even though her class is on accessibility for those with disabilities. The CBL component is poorly integrated with the course as a whole, but it is the only redeeming factor here.

Might just be me, but I felt she was sometimes disinterested in being there, a little disorganized, and was gone way too much. Don't miss a lecture - she doesn't take attendance but it's hard to keep up if you aren't in class - you won't do well on the quizzes without the little nuggets of info you get from lecture.
